title: Function def. by integral, graph of segments part - d

content.description: The function f is defined on the closed interval [-5, 4]. The graph of f consists of three line segments and is shown in the figure above. Let g be the function defined by \(g\left(x\right)=\int_{-3}^xf\left(t\right)dt\).
content.question: The function p is defined by p(x)=f(x2-x). Find the slope of the line tangent to the graph of p at the point where x=-1.

frqParts.text: The function p is defined by p(x)=f(x2-x). Find the slope of the line tangent to the graph of p at the point where x=-1.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
